sen.j: 北朝（ほくちょう）とは、朝廷・王朝・国家などが南北に別れたとき、北側に所在するもののこと。
sen.e: The term "Northern Court" (hokucho in Japanese) describes the Japanese Imperial Court, dynasty, and government that broke off from the Southern Court and was located geographically north of its southern rival at Yoshino.

The term "Northern Court" (hokucho in Japanese) describes the Japanese Imperial Court, dynasty, and government that broke off from the Southern Court and was located geographically north of its southern rival at Yoshino.

The term "Northern Court" (hokucho in Japanese) describes the Japanese Imperial Court, dynasty, and government that broke off from the Southern Court and was located geographically north of its southern rival at Yoshino.

sen.j: 北朝 (日本) - 日本の南北朝時代 (日本)、京都にあった持明院統の朝廷。
sen.e: "Northern Court" refers to the Imperial Court of the Jimyoin lineage, located in Kyoto, that existed during Japan's Nanbokucho (Southern and Northern Courts) period (1336-1392).
"Northern Court" refers to the Imperial Court of the Jimyoin lineage, located in Kyoto, that existed during Japan's Nanbokucho (Southern and Northern Courts) period (1336-1392).
"Northern Court" refers to the Imperial Court of the Jimyoin lineage, located in Kyoto, that existed during Japan's Nanbokucho (Northern and Southern Courts) period.
sen.cmt: スペース補足年号は削除しました。"Southern and Northern" -> "Northern and Southern" に変更しました。

sen.j: 奈良の吉野にあった南朝 (日本)との対比。
sen.e: The term is a geographical contrast to its rival court, the Southern Court of Yoshino, located in Nara south of Kyoto.
The term is a geographical contrast to its rival court, the Southern Court of Yoshino, located in Nara south of Kyoto.
The term is a geographical contrast to its rival court, the Southern Court of Yoshino, located in Nara south of Kyoto.

sen.j: 北朝 - 中国の南北朝時代 (中国)、華北に興った5王朝の総称。
sen.e: "Northern Court" (or Northern Dynasty) is also a general term used to refer to the dynasties of five kings that flourished in northern China during China's Southern and Northern Dynasties period.
"Northern Court" (or Northern Dynasty) is also a general term used to refer to the dynasties of five kings that flourished in northern China during China's Southern and Northern Dynasties period.
"Northern Court" (or Northern Dynasty) is also a general term used to refer to the dynasties of five kings that flourished in northern China during China's Northern and Southern Dynasties period.
sen.cmt: "Southern and Northern" -> "Northern and Southern" に変更しました。

sen.j: 北魏・東魏・西魏・北斉・北周、再統一前の隋。
sen.e: These were those of the Northern Wei, the Eastern Wei, the Western Wei, the Northern Qi, and the Northern Zhou as well as the pre-reunification Sui.
These were those of the Northern Wei, the Eastern Wei, the Western Wei, the Northern Qi, and the Northern Zhou as well as the pre-reunification Sui.
These were those of the Northern Wei, the Eastern Wei, the Western Wei, the Northern Qi, and the Northern Zhou as well as the pre-reunification Sui.

sen.j: 朝鮮民主主義人民共和国（北朝鮮） - 朝鮮半島南部の大韓民国との対比。
sen.e: The term can also be used to describe the contrast between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea) versus the Republic of Korea (South Korea) located in the southern half of the Korean peninsula.

The term can also be used to describe the contrast between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea) versus the Republic of Korea (South Korea) located in the southern half of the Korean peninsula.
